content.text: 1 The probability of picking a green pen from a box is 0.17 .
Find the probability of not picking a green pen from the box.
\(A B C D\) is a quadrilateral.
\(C D E\) is a straight line.
\(A F B\) is an isosceles triangle.
Find the value of \(x\) and the value of \(y\).
not to
The diagram shows a pyramid \(A B C D E\) with a square base.
\(M\) is the centre of the square base.
\(E\) is vertically above \(M\).
(a) Write down the number of planes of symmetry of this pyramid.
(b) Using two of the letters from \(A, B, C, D, E\) and \(M\), complete the statement about the pyramid.
The axis of rotational symmetry passes through the points and
4 The number of ice creams sold increases as the temperature rises.
What type of correlation does this statement describe?
(a) Describe fully the single transformation that maps triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(B\).
(b) On the grid, draw the image of
(i) triangle \(A\) after a reflection in the line \(x=-1\)
(ii) triangle \(A\) after a rotation \(90^{\circ}\) clockwise, centre \((1,-2)\).
6 There are 15 giraffes in a group.
The table gives information about the heights of the 15 giraffes.

table.latex:
\begin{tabular}{|l|}
\hline One giraffe has a height of 2.6 m \\
\hline No giraffe is shorter than 2.5 m \\
\hline The range of heights for the 15 giraffes is 2.3 m \\
\hline More than 3 giraffes have the same height \\
\hline The modal height for the giraffes is 3.9 m \\
\hline
\end{tabular}
table.html:
One giraffe has a height of 2.6 m
No giraffe is shorter than 2.5 m
The range of heights for the 15 giraffes is 2.3 m
More than 3 giraffes have the same height
The modal height for the giraffes is 3.9 m

content.text: The stem-and-leaf diagram shows information about the height of 9 of these giraffes.
Key: 4|1 represents a giraffe height of 4.1 m
Use the information in the table to complete the stem-and-leaf diagram for the group of
15 giraffes.
7 Work out.
Give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form.
Give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form.
8 (a) Write 42 as a product of its prime factors.
(b) Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 84 and 70 .
9 (a) Solve.
(b) \(\quad a x^{2}+a=b \quad\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.
One solution of this equation is \(x=6\).
Write down the other solution.
10 Solve the simultaneous equations.
11 Angela picks a number at random from the numbers 1, 2 and 3 .
She then picks a number at random from the numbers 4,5 and 6 .
She adds the two numbers to find the total.
(a) Complete the table to show the possible outcomes.
(b) Given that the total is odd, find the probability that one of the numbers Angela picks is 3 .
\(12 \quad\) (a) \(\quad \mathbf{v}=\binom{2}{-3}\)
Find \(\mathbf{5 v}\).
(b) \(H\) is the point \((-3,8)\) and \(K\) is the point \((-4,0)\).
Find \(|\overrightarrow{J K}|\).
\(A, B, C\) and \(D\) are points on a circle．
\(E F\) is a tangent to the circle at \(A\) ．
\(A B\) is parallel to \(D C\) ．
（a）Find angle \(D C B\) ，giving a geometrical reason．
Angle \(D C B=\) because
（b）Find angle \(D B C\) ．

\(
\text { Angle } D B C=
\)
14 Find the lowest common multiple（LCM）of \(15 x y^{3}\) and \(18 x^{4} y\) ．
15 (a) Simplify.
(b) \(\quad \frac{40 \sqrt{8}}{5 \sqrt{2}}=k\), where \(k\) is an integer.
Find the value of \(k\).
(c) Rationalise the denominator.
16 Write \(0.3 \dot{2} \dot{8}\) as a fraction in its simplest form.
17 Solid \(A\) is mathematically similar to solid \(B\).
The height of solid \(A\) is 7 cm and its surface area is \(60 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
The surface area of solid \(B\) is \(540 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
Calculate the height of solid \(B\).
18 Make \(t\) the subject of the formula.
19 Simplify.
The diagram shows a sector of a circle, centre \(O\).
The radius of the circle is 6 cm .
Calculate the length of the major \(\operatorname{arc} A B\).
Give your answer in its simplest form in terms of \(\pi\).
21 (a) Differentiate \(x^{3}-3 x^{2}+1\).
(b) Find the coordinates of the turning points of the graph of \(y=x^{3}-3 x^{2}+1\).
\(22 \quad \mathrm{f}(x)=2 x+5 \quad \mathrm{~g}(x)=x-4 \quad \mathrm{~h}(x)=5^{x}\)
(a) Find f(3).
(b) Find \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\).
(c) Solve \(\mathrm{fg}(x)=25\).
(d) Find \(x\) when \(\mathrm{h}^{-1}(x)=2\).
23 (a) Write down the value of \(\cos 90^{\circ}\).
The diagram shows two different right-angled triangles joined by a common side.
Find \(x\) in terms of \(n\).
Question 24 is on the next page.
24 (a) \(A\) is the point \((a, 12)\) and \(B\) is the point \((b, 27)\).
(i) Find the \(y\)-coordinate of the midpoint of \(A B\).
(ii) The line \(A B\) has gradient 3 .
Find an expression for \(a\) in terms of \(b\).
(b) \(D\) is the point \((22,34)\) and \(E\) is the point \((23,39)\).
\(D\) is the point on \(C E\) such that \(2 C E=5 D E\).
Find the coordinates of \(C\).
